title: Successful user login with session persistence
description: Verify that the user can log in with valid credentials and that the session persists across page refreshes.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page
Enter valid username/email and password
Click the login button
Verify that login is successful and dashboard loads according to user role
Refresh the browser page
Confirm that session persists and user remains logged in with correct UI according to role

title: Failed login with incorrect credentials
description: Verify the system rejects login attempts with incorrect username or password and displays appropriate error messages.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page
Enter invalid username/email and/or password
Click the login button
Verify that login fails and an error message is shown

title: Concurrent shift worker login sessions do not conflict
description: Verify that multiple shift workers can log in concurrently on different sessions without data or session conflicts.

steps.description: Open two different browser sessions or devices
Log in shift worker A in session 1 with valid credentials
Log in shift worker B in session 2 with valid credentials
Verify that both sessions maintain independent sessions with no cross data leakage or conflict

title: Create and edit worklog with auto-save feature
description: Verify that a user can create and edit a worklog and that changes are auto-saved to prevent data loss.

steps.description: Navigate to the worklog creation page
Enter new worklog details
Verify that auto-save triggers periodically or after changes
Modify existing worklog fields
Confirm auto-save updates reflect in the database

title: Real-time synchronization of worklog edits and signatures
description: Verify that worklog edits and signatures are synchronized in real-time across multiple users editing simultaneously.

steps.description: User A opens a worklog edit page
User B opens the same worklog on a different device
User A makes an edit and signs the worklog
Verify User B receives real-time update of changes and signature without page reload

title: Signature data parsing handles malformed and null data
description: Verify the system gracefully handles signature fields that are null, contain corrupted JSON, or system auto-close flags without crashing.

steps.description: Simulate saving worklog with null signature data
Verify no crash occurs and fallback UI/logic is shown
Simulate corrupted JSON signature data in worklog
Verify that parsing fails gracefully and error handling logic engages without app crash
Simulate signature with a system auto-close indicator
Verify UI and data reflect correct closed status appropriately

title: Shift scheduling calculates shifts accurately including edge cases
description: Verify shift rotations for 3-shift and 4-shift patterns including edge cases such as leap years and month transitions calculate correctly.

steps.description: Set shift pattern to 3-shift with start date including end of month
Verify shift rotations align correctly and continue properly into next month
Set shift pattern with leap year date ranges
Validate correct shift scheduling including leap day
Set shift pattern to 4-shift rotation and confirm schedule generation
Verify shift sequence and assignments are accurate

title: Shift swap operations update across UI and data correctly
description: Verify that shifts swapped between users update immediately in the schedule, worklogs, and dashboard data without inconsistencies.

steps.description: Initiate a shift swap request between two users via the shift management UI
Verify that the shift swap reflects in the shift schedule immediately
Confirm updated shift assignments appear correctly on each userâ€™s worklogs
Verify the dashboard displays updated shift statuses and counts accurately

title: Dashboard displays statistics, recent posts and signature progress with layout responsiveness
description: Verify that the main dashboard widgets load correct data and remain stable and responsive across desktop and mobile layouts including no-data and overflow conditions.

steps.description: Log in as user and navigate to the main dashboard
Verify statistics, recent posts, and signature progress widgets display correct and up-to-date information
Test dashboard on desktop with large dataset (overflow scenario)
Confirm layout integrity is maintained and no UI elements overlap or misalign
Test dashboard on multiple mobile devices and screen sizes
Verify responsive design adapts view correctly for smaller screens and tables remain usable

title: Issue posting with editor component functions correctly
description: Verify user can create, edit, and post issues or notices using the editor component and posts appear in the dashboard feed.

steps.description: Navigate to the issue posting interface
Enter issue or notice content using the editor
Submit the post
Verify that the post appears immediately in the recent posts section of the dashboard
Edit an existing post and resubmit
Confirm edited post updates successfully and reflects changes in real-time

title: Dialog overlays and focus management work without UI conflicts
description: Verify that opening dialogs for issue posting, worklog details, or worker registration overlay correctly without interfering with underlying UI and maintain proper keyboard focus management.

steps.description: Open the issue posting dialog from the dashboard
Verify the dialog overlays the main UI without layout breakage
Check that keyboard focus is trapped inside the dialog
Open worker registration dialog on top of existing overlays
Confirm correct overlay stacking and focus management
Close dialogs via close button and verify focus returns to previously focused element

title: Logout clears sensitive state and prevents stale data retention
description: Verify that logging out clears all sensitive data from client state stores and that no stale or sensitive data remains accessible after logout.

steps.description: Log in and perform various actions such as viewing and editing worklogs and shifts
Click the logout button
Verify user is redirected to login page
Confirm all sensitive state in Zustand stores is wiped and cannot be accessed
Attempt to use back button or reopen pages without logging in again
Verify no residual sensitive data or UI from the previous session is visible or accessible

title: State management avoids unnecessary re-renders
description: Verify that the state store selectors and updates minimize unnecessary component re-renders ensuring optimal performance under typical usage.

steps.description: Perform typical user actions such as toggling worklog fields, posting issues, and viewing dashboard
Use profiling tools to verify components only re-render on relevant state changes
Check that unrelated component parts do not re-render unnecessarily
